snippet: A federal appeals court panel ruled on Tuesday that a voter-approved ban on same-sex marriage in California violated the Constitution, all but ensuring that the case will proceed to the United States Supreme Court.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court panel ruled on Tuesday that a voter-approved ban on same-sex marriage in California violated the Constitution, all but ensuring that the case will proceed to the United States Supreme Court.

headline.main: Appeals Court Ruling on California’s Proposition 8

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
